chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Warren C Stonecypher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

No contact with the victim(s) without prior court/agent approval. 
No contact with mom without prior agent approval
No unsupervised contact with children 16 years of age and under.
No internet without agent approval.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution is set at $0.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in court.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court with Warren C Stonecypher.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim Advocate: Selia Patterson in court.

Court finds the State has complied with victim notification.  Statements made as to sentencing.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, with credit for 183 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim(s) without prior court/agent approval. 
* No contact with mom without prior agent approval
* No unsupervised contact with children 16 years of age and under.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* No internet without agent approval.
* Restitution is set at $0.

Appeal rights given.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
Filed,

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 

Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
received and filed.

Witness fee request prepared for Alyssa O. was approved for 1 appearance on 7/25/22 by the DA's Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request prepared for Sarah O. was approved for 1 appearance on 7/25/22 by the DA's Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request prepared for Shaun O. was approved for 1 appearance on 7/25/22 by the DA's Victim/Witness Services.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his/her client.   Amended Information charges Defendant as follows

AS TO COUNT 1:  SECOND DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT OF A CHILD (<16 YEARS OF AGE), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.02(2), 939.50(3)(c), a Class C Felony.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms body armor; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court orders defendant REMANDED to the custody of the Sheriff pending sentencing hearing.  Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing.  Parties do not request a Court ordered PSI.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04E (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. Parties remain in a jury trial posture. Final pretrial discussions held. State revokes final offer. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 07/25/2022.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Notice of Expert Testimony.
Defense motion

Correction to Rescheduled entry on 06/28/2022:
Final Pre-trial is scheduled for 7-15-2022 @ 10:30am.
Court is DOWN. Matter is rescheduled. Parties notified.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense demand for speedy trial, expires 08/25/2022

Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Speedy trial demand entered by defense. Case set for final pretrial on 06/28/2022 at 8:30am.  Jury trial set for 07/25/2022 at 9:00am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 06/25/2022. Any evidentiary matters will be heard on final pretrial date. Case is adjourned in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court will allow for 3rd party contact between S.E.O. only for the logistics of moving. Such 3rd party contact will expire on 06-10-2022; at that time NO CONTACT ORDER WILL REVERT TO THE ORIGINAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS of the NO Contact Order from 03-22-2022.

Defense motion for reduction of cash bail DENIED by the Court. Court will allow for 3rd party contact between S.E.O. only for the logistics of moving. Such 3rd party contact will expire on 06-10-2022; at that time NO CONTACT ORDER WILL REVERT TO THE ORIGINAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS of the NO Contact Order from 03-22-2022.

Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in custody.  
Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter in court for arraignment. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty and request status conference and bail review. Case remains calendared before branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnson; both appear by video.  Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Lonnie Christianson - West Allis Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Information contained errors. Matter is set for arraignment. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Arraignment scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.C.O and S.E.O

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.    If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.

Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Warren C Stonecypher in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case retabbed to Branch 15 due to the nature of the charges. Warren C Stonecypher appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
